name: Praseodymium
educationalNotes: Praseodymium is rare earth with unique properties - 'green' of rare earth magnets! Praseodymium alloys with nickel make super-strong permanent magnets. Praseodymium oxide used in coloring glass and ceramics (yellow/green tones). Discovered in 1885. Named from Greek 'prasios' (green) and 'didymos' (twin). Critical for modern electronics and renewable energy (wind turbines). Supply concentrated in China (geopolitical concern). High price volatility.

diffusion.usage: Sum atomic contributions for compound Σv, then: D_AB = 0.00143×T^1.75 / (P × M_AB^0.5 × (Σv_A^(1/3) + Σv_B^(1/3))²)
